![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png) Ok I have been running in circles. Too many ways of doing the same thing...  

I am trying to create an all-in-one repair support flash drive on an 8GB flash drive (SanDisk Cruzer). Since it is easier to update a flash drive than a cd/iso.   
I am trying to create a simple boot menu to select programs (Aero Studio, GRUB4DOS ![:huh:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/huh.png))... Later I will need to consolidate some of the programs (remove doubles/overlaps). Only using 1 partition and not looking for Win installers.  

I am trying to incorporate the following:  

UBCD4Win (XP only? or similar program)  
Vista PE (works with both XP and Vista?)  
UBCD (v 4.1.1)  
Back Track (v 3)  
KNOPPIX (5.3.1)

Suggestions are greatly appreciated.
